transportAdvice: Mendoza's city center is compact and walkable, with the main plazas, restaurants, and shops easily reached on foot. Public buses serve the wider metropolitan area and wine regions, and taxis are widely available for reaching vineyards and attractions beyond the center.

weather.description: Hot, dry summer days with intense sunshine and occasional afternoon thunderstorms.
Continued summer heat with low humidity and mostly clear skies, ideal for outdoor activities.
Temperatures begin to ease as autumn approaches, with slightly more frequent rain and pleasant evenings.
Mild and comfortable autumn weather with golden vineyard foliage making this a scenic time to visit.
Cooler temperatures arrive with crisp mornings and occasional rain, marking the transition to winter.
Cool winter conditions with cold nights and the possibility of frost, though snow in the city is rare.
The coldest month of the year with clear, dry days and very cold nights; snow visible on the Andes.
Still cold but days begin to lengthen with clear skies and dry conditions persisting.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and blossoming vineyards, though winds can be strong.
Warm and increasingly sunny with the wine harvest season in full swing and lively outdoor atmosphere.
Hot and dry pre-summer conditions with long sunny days perfect for wine touring and hiking.
Full summer heat returns with intense sun and low humidity; early mornings are best for outdoor activities.
